meanings.definition: To crush or flatten with a steamroller.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers will steamroll the new road to make it smooth.
meanings.sent2: The steamroller will steamroll the asphalt to create a flat surface.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if the steamroller will steamroll any obstacles in its path.
meanings.sent4: The steamroller seemed to steamroll everything in its way, leaving a perfectly flat road behind.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise of the steamroller as it steamrolls the ground is quite impressive.

meanings.sent1: The team managed to steamroll their opponents in the final match.
meanings.sent2: The powerful army was able to steamroll through the enemy defenses.
meanings.sent3: It was surprising to see how easily they could steamroll the competition.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to steamroll everything in its path, leaving destruction behind.
meanings.sent5: The determined leader was able to steamroll any obstacles in his way to success.

meanings.definition: To proceed with relentless force or speed.
meanings.sent1: The project will steamroll ahead to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The train started to steamroll down the tracks at full speed.
meanings.sent3: The idea began to steamroll in his mind, gaining momentum quickly.
meanings.sent4: The movement started to steamroll across the nation, gaining support rapidly.
meanings.sent5: The momentum of the campaign began to steamroll, attracting more and more followers.
